lessons.title: Module 1 Quiz: React & TypeScript Basics
lessons.description: Test your understanding of React and TypeScript fundamentals

questions.question: What is JSX?
questions.explanation: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that allows you to write HTML-like code in your React components.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using TypeScript with React?
options: Type safety and better development experience
questions.explanation: TypeScript provides type safety and improves the development experience with better IntelliSense and error catching at compile time.

questions.question: React components must always return JSX elements.
questions.explanation: React components can return JSX elements, strings, numbers, arrays, or null. They don't always have to return JSX.

notes.content: React is a library for building user interfaces. Key concepts: Components, JSX, Virtual DOM
Remember to install Node.js LTS version. Vite is faster than Create React App for development.
ES6 arrow functions are more concise and don't bind their own 'this'
Design thinking process: Empathize, Define, Ideate, Prototype, Test
